feed.title: Concerns Regarding Threats by a Developer to Remove Commit Access from Other Developers

entry.title: Concerns Regarding Threats by a Developer to Remove Commit Access from Other Developers
entry.summary: The context discusses the concerns over when to transition from subsidies to fees in Bitcoin. The author believes that the decision should be left up to the miners and worries about the risks of making this transition too late. They question what the price of an email should be and how much DARPA should have charged for using TCP/IP. The author expresses their concern towards the argument of commercial returns on a decentralized protocol, suggesting that it could potentially benefit the unbanked rather than just providing profits for the already rich.
